ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Writing a long paper. Synthesizing literature.
In this class, we worked to build on the work from the Research Methods class and steadily produce the culminating senior essay.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This class was very effective for keeping me on track for my thesis and was a great way of bonding with my classmates. These were the main strengths of the course. On the other side of things, the course structure was occasionally confusing and I sometimes wasn't sure about what I was supposed to be doing on a week to week basis

One strength of this class is that it meets every week, which strongly encourages you to make progress from week to week. A weakness of this class is that there aren't built-in requirements about communication with your advisor. I think it would be helpful if weekly assignments about reporting progress to the class also required reporting your progress to your advisor. It is both helpful and unhelpful that deadlines in this class are not very strict. On one hand, sometimes you feel like you need flexibility. On the other, in the long run, for the writing of the senior thesis, I feel like a greater number of intermediary deadlines would have been helpful to prevent me from writing everything at the last-minute.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Linguistics majors must take this course.
This course is required, but I would highly recommend it because it's very cool to see what complicated topics in the field we're now able to address.

The challenges, strengths, and experiences of this course are so unique, so tailored to the individuals chosen topic and advisor, that its difficult to give an assessment of the course that is meaningful for anyone other than myself.
